data.title: Almere City FC new EFDN member
data.meta_description: EFDN is delighted to welcome Almere City FC as a new member in the network. The club wants to share its work, learn from other members and integrate good practices in its community operations. With a history of only 15 years, Almere City FC is the youngest professional football club Read more
data.text:
EFDN is delighted to welcome Almere City FC as a new member in the network. The club wants to share its work, learn from other members and integrate good practices in its community operations.

With a history of only 15 years, Almere City FC is the youngest professional football club in the Netherlands. Their main and strategic community programme ‘Almere & The City’ consists of 8 projects addressing local social issues. The city of Almere is a so called ‘New town’ with 210.000 inhabitants. Founded just 40 years ago with a fast-growing diverse population. Facing known and specific challenges.

The club believes that vitality, both physical as well as mental, is a key driver for healthy, happy and prosperous lives. Together with connected businesses, the city of Almere, community services and citizens, Almere City FC can boost social and economic vitality in the city of Almere. Read more about the mission and goals of our new member here.
